Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of western civilization from 1648 to present. May be taken before EUH 2000.

EUH3130 - Medieval Knights & Age of Chiv.name: EUH3130 - Medieval Knights & Age of Chivalry

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or equivalent, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Dynamics of aristocratic society in high medieval Europe, including: chivalry; castle-building; jousts; the Crusades and military orders; and other social and cultural themes.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Influence of Renaissance humanism on arts, letters, and politics; Luther and Protestantism; the Catholic Counter-Reformation and the Thirty Years' War.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: France beginning with Wars of Religion. Topics include Absolutism and Louis XIV, nation building, the Enlightenment, imperial expansion, and the French Revolution.

EUH3180 - Sorcerers, Saints and Heretics.name: EUH3180 - Sorcerers, Saints and Heretics: Religion in the Medieval World

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the mixture of superstition, paganism, heresies, Jewish and Muslim communities and the rising Catholic Church that formed religious life and shaped society and culture in Medieval Europe.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The phenomenon of crusading in medieval Europe and the Middle East, including theories of "just war" and jihad.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cultural, political and social developments in Ireland after 1800.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Evolution of weapons, tactics, strategy; role, social status, recruitment of soldiers; influence of military on governments; and international efforts to preserve peace.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Napoleon and nationalism; new ideas; conservation; liberalism, romanticism, republicanism and socialism; urbanization, technology and mass culture, religious decline; Realpolitik, racism, imperialism, and militarism.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history of modern Italy from the origins of national unification through the post-World War II era.

EUH3180H - Honors Saints, Sorcerers, and.name: EUH3180H - Honors Saints, Sorcerers, and Heretics: Religion in the Medieval World

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the mixture of superstition, paganism, heresies, Jewish and Muslim communities and the rising Catholic Church that shaped religious life, society and culture in Medieval Europe. With honors content.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Ireland's historical and cultural development from 1129 to 1607.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of western civilization from ancient to 1648.

EUH3281 - Second World War and Rebirth o.name: EUH3281 - Second World War and Rebirth of Europe

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Origins of World War II; Hitler's "New Order," and resistance movements; Cold War; de-Stalinization of Russia; Sovietization of East Central Europe; Western reconstruction, and prosperity.

EUH3242 - Modern Europe and the First Wo.name: EUH3242 - Modern Europe and the First World War

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the impact of the democratic institutions, education, transportation, housing, health, mass communications, entertainment, women, and warfare.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Political, religious, and cultural history of the Iberian Peninsula from the fall of Rome to collapse of the Umayyad Caliphate and the start of the Crusades

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: France beginning with the Napoleonic era. Topics include nineteenth century social, political and consumer revolutions, the World Wars, the Cold War, imperialism and decolonization.

EUH3411 - History of the Roman Republic.name: EUH3411 - History of the Roman Republic

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of Roman civilization from 753 BC to 31 BC.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or equivalent, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The political, social, and economic development of Spain from frontier kingdom to global superpower.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or EUH 2000, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: European conflicts from the Hundred Years' War to the Thirty Years' War. Focuses on major battles and campaigns, and on political, social, and religious context.

EUH4400 - The History of Ancient Greece.name: EUH4400 - The History of Ancient Greece

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history and culture of the Mediterranean world and the ancient Near East from 750 BCE to 323 BCE.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of 'C' (2.0) or higher required in ENC 1102 or EUH 2001, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The political, economic, and cultural development of Spain from the Spanish Golden Age to the present.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The Cold War from the homefront perspective addressing both sides of the Iron Curtain.

EUH4284 - Fascism and Nazism in the Inte.name: EUH4284 - Fascism and Nazism in the Interwar Europe

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fascist and Nazi movements in interwar Europe, mostly Italy and Germany. Origin, development, seizure of power, system of government, ideology, domestic and foreign policies, resistance to these movements.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Alexander I; Napoleonic Invasion, Revolutionary Movement; Russian Policy toward Central Asia and China; Great Reforms; Russo-Japanese War; Revolution of 1905; Constitutional Period; Triple Entente.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Kievan State; Mongol Yoke; Development of Muscovite Expansionism and Absolutism; Time of Troubles; Westernization of Russia under Peter I and Catherine; Role of Orthodox Church.

EUH4610 - Women in European Society: Fro.name: EUH4610 - Women in European Society: From Medieval to Modern

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course examines the changing situation of women in Europe from the Middle Ages to the twentieth century.

EUH4610H - Honors Women in European Soci.name: EUH4610H - Honors Women in European Society

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: GEP Honors completion or permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary approach to the changing situation of women in Europe across space and over time with honors-level content.

EUH4663 - History of Communism in Europe.name: EUH4663 - History of Communism in Europe

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of communist movements and regimes in Europe from mid-19th century to the fall of the Berlin Wall. The course focuses on the history of communism outside of Russia and opposition to the communist regimes.

EUH4402 - The Age of Alexander the Great.name: EUH4402 - The Age of Alexander the Great

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Addresses the history of the Hellenistic period and the spread and impact of Greek culture on non-Greek societies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Congress of Vienna, Metternich's system Crimean War, unifications of Italy& Germany, the Bismarckian era, the alliance systems, and the outbreak of World War I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores English law from the first Germanic law codes in the seventh century to the publication of Blackstone's Commentaries on the Laws of England.

EUH4413 - History of the Roman Empire.name: EUH4413 - History of the Roman Empire

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: EUH 2000 or WOH 2012 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The history of Roman civilization from 31 BC to AD 476

EUH4426 - Sex and Gender in Antiquity.name: EUH4426 - Sex and Gender in Antiquity

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines the concepts of sex and gender in Greek and Roman societies and their impact on modern society.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: German nationalism and militarism; World War I and Versailles Treaty; the Weimar Republic and the rise of the Nazis; Second World War, division and recovery.

EUH4576 - History of Russia in the 20th.name: EUH4576 - History of Russia in the 20th Century

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: War and Revolution, Lenin, Stalinist Period, WWII, The Cold War. Collapse of Soviet Union, the New Russia.

EUH4674 - Sport and Society in the Ancie.name: EUH4674 - Sport and Society in the Ancient World

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A comparison of the original form of the Olympic Games (and ancient notions of sport) to their modern counterparts.

EUH4674H - Honors Sports & Society in th.name: EUH4674H - Honors Sports & Society in the Ancient World

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: GEP Honors completion or permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Interdisciplinary approach to comparing the Original Olympic games and other ancient athletic spectacles with their modern counterparts with honors-level content.
